isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 9000 Pro Sleeper After 05/01/1997, and 9800 Model After 07/01/1997 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - AIR CONDITIONING AND HEATER CONTROL Cable (92/93/94/9900)

svcproc.title: AIR CONDITIONING AND HEATER CONTROL Cable (92/93/94/9900)

warning.para: Batteries expel explosive gases. Keep sparks, flames, burning cigarettes, or other ignition sources away at all times. Always wear safety glasses and a face shield when working near batteries to prevent personal injury.

step1.para: Disconnect negative battery cable.
Remove the passenger seat and Blend-Air unit cover. Refer to BLEND-AIR UNIT COVER, Remove .
Remove floor mat ( Figure 50).
Remove screws from dash cover panel ( Figure 46). Remove cover panel.
Remove four screws from cab control assembly ( Figure 47).
Carefully slide control assembly out of dash ( Figure 48).
Remove screw securing HOT-COLD control cable to control assembly ( Figure 49).
Remove control cable end from HOT-COLD cable lever.
Inside Blend-Air unit, remove hold down clamp for HOT-COLD cable. Refer to Figure 51 and Figure 1.
Inside Blend-Air unit, remove clip that secures HOT-COLD cable to cab Blend-Air door, and disconnect cable from door ( Figure 51 and Figure 1).
Remove HOT-COLD cable from Blend-Air unit and dash, taking note of cable routing and clipping.

figure.caption: Figure 51. Connection of HOT-COLD Cable to Cab Blend-Door Assembly

important.para: In the following step, adjuster end of cable must be located at dash control assembly.

step1.para: Route HOT-COLD cable from dash to Blend-Air unit as previously removed.
Verify cable works freely and is free of kinks and tight bends.
Connect cable end to HOT-COLD cable lever on control assembly ( Figure 49).
Install screw securing HOT-COLD control cable to control assembly.
Slide control assembly into dash and secure with four mounting screws ( Figure 47).
Install dash cover panel ( Figure 46).
Inside Blend-Air unit, attach end of HOT-COLD cable to cab Blend-Air door and secure with clip removed previously. Refer to Figure 51.
Inside Blend-Air unit, install hold down clamp for HOT-COLD cable ( Figure 51).
Verify that the HOT-COLD cable is routed and secured as it originally was.
Install floor mat using mounting hardware previously removed ( Figure 50).
Install the passenger seat and Blend-Air unit cover. Refer to BLEND-AIR UNIT COVER, Install .
Adjust HOT-COLD cable as indicated in the following steps.
After adjustment is completed, connect negative battery cable.
Remove dash switch panel to access top of dash control assembly ( Figure 52). It should not be necessary to disconnect switch panel electrical harness.
Set HOT-COLD lever to full HOT position.
With dash switch panel removed, access cable adjuster through hole in dash ( Figure 53).

figure.caption: Figure 53. With Switch Panel Removed, Access Control Cable Adjuster

step1.para: Turn cable adjuster so lever is near end of slot but not touching end of slot.
Move lever to maximum COLD position.
Turn cable adjuster again so that lever is the same distance from the slot end in both directions.
Install dash switch panel ( Figure 52).
